answers.answer: I'm not sure of the cause, but you definitely need to see a doctor, preferably your OB/GYN.  It's very likely to be making you anemic.
I have had the same problem.  I do not want to go on progesterone or the birth control pill due to my age of 45any other suggestions.

I had exactly the same thing 3 years ago. I bled for 30 days with pains in my side. I was eventually taken into hospital because i was in agony. The doctor told me i had suffered from an etopic pregnancy which i lost through miscarrige. After antibiotics i was fine. Good luck!!

I've been there; I was so exhausted and anemic.  I was diagnosed as having an underactive thyroid (hypothyroid & Hashimoto's).  Do you know if that runs in your family...or do other autoimmune disorders (diabetes or lupus, etc)?  It could be endometriosis or PCOS as well.  See your doc and ask him/her to check your thyroid levels (TSH).  Do you have other symptoms??
Could also be an ovarian cyst - extra long periods are a very common symptom.  99% of ovarian cysts are benign though!  Go get checked out right away!

I'm dealing with the same thing right now.  I've been bleeding for 17 days, although on the pill.  I went to the doc, they checked if I'm anemic..  guess not, since they didn't call to say anything was wrong with my blood work.  This darn pill is supposed to make me regular and obviously this isn't happening.  Sorry I'm frustrated, as you probably are by now.  My doc seems to be blowing me off, but I do have an ultrasound scheduled, after insisting that this just can't be normal.  I hope you have better luck...  keep us posted as I'm interested to see what happens when you go to the doc.
I've had very bad cramps and also a lot of vomitting, loss of appetite. There's no way I'm pregnant unless its an immaculate conception!

Today is August 2 and i've had my period since July 2. I started on the pill on sunday but it doesn't seem to be helping. I am Extremly tired and i don't feel like doing Anything anymore. I'm starting to wonder if there is something really wrong with me.

question: I've been bleeding, exactly like a period, for 33 days. It has fluctuated between very heavy and moderate and has been very painful. I haven't managed to get to a GP. I think it might be making me anaemic. Can anyone help shed light on my problem?
title: 33 day long period
